dict.acceptation: 不可避免地，自然而然地；必然地，无疑的；难免；终于只好；

sent.orig: Smooth blasting of slope excavation would inevitably bring on damnification of slope remaining rock mass.
sent.trans: 边坡开挖爆破必然造成边坡保留岩体的损伤。

sent.orig: Must a short essay inevitably be one-sided?
sent.trans: 杂文是不是一定会带片面性？

sent.orig: Inevitably, the observer of growth is impressed with the variety of responses.
sent.trans: 研究生长的人不可避免地易被种种反应所吸引。

sent.orig: But because of the restriction of historical condition Condorcet's thought had fantasticality inevitably. "
sent.trans: 但是，由于社会历史条件的限制，孔多塞的启蒙思想又不可避免地带有空想性。

sent.orig: Computing with low-powered tablets and handsets inevitably means offloading some processing to the cloud.
sent.trans: 使用低配置平板和手持设备就不可避免地意味着要将一些处理工作上载到云上。
